group_1.textRight: *Sigh*... It's been a day with nothin' but surprises.

group_1.textLeft: I wouldn't have thought the Wishing Star was a @door to another world.
I wonder what kind of world the Three Magi live @in...?

group_1.textRight: I've been improving the receiver and decoding the signal little by little,
but we still...can't make out anything other than @bits and pieces.
However, I think I've identified the band used by one @of the Three Magi.
That song we received at the Central Tower also @came from there.

group_1.textLeft: Are the Three Magi Sayu-Sayu fans...?

group_1.textRight: It's not just that song, there's a lot of information @flying around...
We've found out some amazing things, like secrets about this world.

group_1.textLeft: Can we hear too?

group_1.textRight: Yeah...
Since it was all obtained from decoding signals, @this knowledge is a little unreliable, but...
In this world,
everything is made up of units called "pixels".
If you break down the pixel further, it becomes the smallest unit called a "bit".
These bits are the signals
which allow for interaction between this world and @that world.

group_1.textLeft: Um...[chara:120302:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:120302:cheek_0][chara:120302:face_mtn_ex_030.exp.json][chara:120302:lipSynch_1]in other words, what does that all mean?

group_1.textRight: In order to send our message to the world of the @Three Magi,
we just need enough energy output... From there, @transmitting the information material that we're @made of,
ourselves in other words, should be possible.
Oi, that's friggin' awesome!

group_1.textLeft: You mean we can cross over the End of the World @into the other world?
Yeah...theoretically.

group_1.textRight: But it would take an enormous amount of energy to @do so.
First, we should start with what's feasible...
We're currently experimenting on delivering @something smaller.

group_1.textLeft: But even that...requires an absurd amount of @energy.
What do ya mean by somethin' smaller?

group_1.textRight: Our voices.

group_1.textLeft: Voices...? Ah, that would be...

group_1.textRight: Yup, your favorite Pirate Radio Central!

group_1.textLeft: We hijacked the Central Tower's antenna
to continue experimenting with sending signals to various places.
That was what the broadcast was for!?

group_1.textRight: Yes! The yessest of Yesses!

group_1.textLeft: Huh? You're not sendin' them to the other side of @the End of the World...?

group_1.textRight: Of course that's what we'll do when we do it for@real... But right now, we don't have enough output.
In the meantime, in order to tune the tower equipment...
We're continuing broadcasting testing in the form@of Pirate Radio.
Well, half of it is Meguru's hobby!

group_1.textLeft: Ain't half too much!?
Is Yukika helping out too?

group_1.textRight: Yes... I'm an assistant and something like Hibiki's bodyguard.
I'm using the old railyard in Junk City as a studio.
That area's also very dangerous, so I asked for her protection!

group_1.textLeft: It seems that I am predisposed to attracting trouble.
I think it would be safer if we were not together...

group_1.textRight: I'm still alive today, so it's A-OK, there's no problem!

group_1.textLeft: There are a few problems with that...

group_1.textRight: Hey, Tsuruno!
Ain't this the Reindeer Santas' turn to shine?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah it is!
Let's bring smiles to everyone in the Junk House!

group_1.textRight: Looks like it's time to use this guy!
That's...?
